title: fix(format): format demo and sample code with ruff
body:
The current codebase includes inconsistent formatting and many unused imports.

This PR applies [ruff](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/), which is listed in the [dev dependencies](https://github.com/google/A2A/blob/251cd37d5e6ccbc985bb8d0d78c03d665fa86699/demo/ui/pyproject.toml#L34) to:
- Format the Python code
- Sort and fix import statements
- Remove unused imports

Note: the code style expectations are not clearly defined in the contributing guide. It‚Äôs unclear whether the project intends to follow [Google Python Style](https://google.github.io/styleguide/pyguide.html), use [yapf](https://github.com/google/yapf), or rely on ruff.
Since ruff is already present in the pyproject.toml, I‚Äôve assumed it‚Äôs intended to be used for formatting.

If that‚Äôs not the case, feel free to close this PR or suggest the preferred formatting tool.

title: feature: Golang sample implementation
body:
Okay, I got very caffeinated and decided we need something in Golang, because this was the only way I could wrap my head around this. The PR introduces a Go implementation of the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol, focusing on the core server and client components. It does not yet cover additional golang agents ( I'll do that in another PR if you accept this ).

CLA signed... 


## Changes

### Server Implementation
Implemented a JSON-RPC 2.0 server/client
Added support for core A2A methods:
tasks/send: Send new tasks
tasks/get: Retrieve task status
tasks/cancel: Cancel running tasks
Implemented thread-safe task storage
Error handling with A2A error codes etc
Created extensive test coverage for server functionality
### Client Implementation
 support for all core A2A methods
Created test suite for client (Thanks Copilot üëç)
### Models Package
Defined type-safe structures for:
Task management
Error handling
Implemented JSON serialization/deserialization
Added validation for all data structures
Added streaming support

### Documentation
Created README files for:
Server package
Client package
Models package
Added usage examples and API documentation
Included testing instructions

## Pending Work
Agent implementation is not included in this PR and will be addressed in a future update
The current implementation focuses on the core protocol and infrastructure
Agent-specific functionality (like skill execution, capability negotiation, etc.) will be implemented separately.

title: Fix environment variable loading and documentation for sample
body:
## Problem
- LangGraph agent fails with `GOOGLE_API_KEY environment variable not set`
- README files lack API key setup instructions
- Multiple path errors in documentation:
  - CLI docs with incorrect path (`cd sample`)
  - ADK agent docs with incorrect navigation and run instructions

## Solution
- Add `load_dotenv()` to [`samples/python/agents/langgraph/__main__.py`](https://claude.ai/samples/python/agents/langgraph/__main__.py)
- Add .env file setup instructions to [`samples/python/README.md`](https://claude.ai/samples/python/README.md)
- Fix path in [`samples/python/hosts/cli/README.md`](https://claude.ai/samples/python/hosts/cli/README.md) to `cd samples/python`
- Fix path and instructions in [`samples/python/agents/google_adk/README.md`](https://claude.ai/samples/python/agents/google_adk/README.md)

## Result
- All sample agents (LangGraph and ADK) now run successfully out-of-the-box
- Navigation paths are consistent with actual repository structure
- Improved onboarding experience for new users

feat: run the code in daytona
body:
This PR adds a prompt for running the code that the coder generated - the code is run in a secure and isolated Daytona Sandbox that spins up in a fraction of a second and runs the arbitrary Python/TypeScript code

How to use it:

1. First terminal window:
`export GEMINI_API_KEY=<your-gemini-api-key>`
`npm run agents:coder`

2. Second terminal window:
`export DAYTONA_API_KEY=<your-daytona-api-key`
`npm run a2a:cli:daytona`

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ace8fa4-4d63-44b5-bffa-3ae95abc6a46)


This is a simple addition to the Coder sample as a proof of work implementation of an AI runtime. We are working on an A2A implementation with our sandbox orchestration agent that will be released soon. Interested in the feedback from the team.
